results.title: Auxiliary views. Pt. 1
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mechanical Drawing”.
Begins by showing that the three principal views do not represent the true surface of an object that has one or more slanting faces. This condition is shown to require projection of the slanting surface on a plane which is parallel to it and is not one of the principle planes. This auxiliary projection is explained and defined. No other credits available.

results.title: Auxiliary views: double auxiliaries
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and Pathescope Company of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Engineering Drawing”.
Begins with a quick view of orthographic projection on three principal planes and on auxiliary planes; then points out that a new condition is introduced if the object to be drawn has a slanting face that is not perpendicular to any of the principal planes. The film shows why a single auxiliary view does not give an accurate picture of an oblique face. The theory of double auxiliary or oblique view is then described in detail, using the visualization effects of combined animated drawings and animated models.

results.title: Autumn and cardboard
results.brief_description: An impressionistic and witty portrayal of the election rituals which periodically grip the U.S. electorate - usually in the fall. Using the 1966 Reagan - Brown campaign in California as an example, the film conveys the excitement, rhetoric and rivalry with which the candidates and the issues are presented to the public. Narrated by Lee Marvin. No other credits available.

results.title: Autos, autos everywhere
results.creator_credit: Philip Burton, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
The redesign, computerization and possible elimination of automobiles in the next century is predicted in this film. Experimental models using new power sources, and the trend towards taking responsibility away from human drivers are examined. A partially automated driving system, as well as dual-mode cars which hook up to an electric rail roadway where computers take full control are demonstrated. Major considerations in the prototypes studied are safety, air pollution and traffic congestion. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: The Autonomic nervous system
results.brief_description: Extraordinary photographs of living organs shows the autonomic nervous system controlling involuntary body processes such as breathing, heart rate, blood pressure and digestion. Animation is used to illustrate the sympathetic and parasympathetic divisions of the autonomic nervous system and the part it is thought to play in the human emotions. No other credits available.

results.title: Automation: what it is and what it does
results.brief_description: Explores the meaning and levels of automation from an electric can opener to transfer machines in an assembly line to the more sophisticated feed back of a computer controlled refinery. Encourages the student to explore the implications of increasing automation for the future. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Automation : see it now
results.creator_credit: Edward Murrow and Fred W Friendly
results.brief_description: A documentary report on the modern day industrial revolution, Automation. It traces the earlier mechanization in industry and shows the application of the newer automation in present-day industry. Between the extremes of considering automation a menace to our way of life, or as the solution of every problem, the film presents viewpoints on the subjects ranging from a working man to the head of I.B.M. All state it is inevitable. Automation is shown in such industries as the automotive, aviation, baking, electronics, manufacturing industries and many others.

results.title: Automania 2000
results.creator_credit: John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: An animated satire on problems of automotive design and lack of proper roads and parking facilities. Shows what could happen in the year 2000 when people are forced to live in their cars and the car finally becomes able to reproduce itself. Animator: Harold Whitaker; Writer: Joy Batchelor.

results.title: Autobahn
results.brief_description: An animated film by John Halas which attempts to convey the experience of a car journey in the form of abstract imagery. Animation, movement, colour and sound are combined to emphasise Kraftwerk’s famous musical composition. Intended audience: secondary school through adult.

results.title: Auto suggestion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
Illustrates technical advances in the British motor-car industry showing the fine quality and workmanship of products manufactured. Cars shown include the following: Daimler Straight Eight, Rolls-Royce Silver Wraith, Morris Minor, Vauxhall Wyvern, Austin A40, Hillman Minx, Ford Prefect, Triumph Mayflower, Jaguar XK120 amd Mark VII Saloon, Ford Consul, Triumph Roadster, production version of the 2.1/2 litre Aston Marton, Bristol 401, and the experimental Rover Gas Turbine prototype.
